message.raw:
Fixed bug in detection of whether a shot is a rep that caused it to crash on
non-reps.

More strict requirements of whether a filename is considered a repeated shot

(i.e that it matches the format [something]_rep[numbers].h5, and only looks at
the numbers at the end even if "_rep" appears elsewhere in the filename)

Duplicated the more strict requirements in queue.py's related check that it uses
to check if a file is a rep for purposes of making new reps.

Fixed bug in detection of whether a shot is a rep that caused it to crash on
non-reps.

More strict requirements of whether a filename is considered a repeated shot

(i.e that it matches the format [something]_rep[numbers].h5, and only looks at
the numbers at the end even if "_rep" appears elsewhere in the filename)

Duplicated the more strict requirements in queue.py's related check that it uses
to check if a file is a rep for purposes of making new reps.

message.raw:
Functionality to delete repeated shots such that only a finite number of repeated
shots are kept on disk at any one time. This prevents consuming disk space in
the case of an expeiment being "kept warm" by being left in repeat mode.

This functionality is implemented via a plugin, using a new callback for BLACS
plugins called "shot_complete". The shot deletion is done in a
separate thread so as not to slow down the experiment in the case of blocking
calls, and a zlock lock is acquired on the file prior to deletion
to minimise the harm done if say, a lyse routine is reading the file.

There is sensible behaviour in the case of the user decreasing the number of
shots to retain on disk. Shots that are queued for deletion are kept in a queue,
and when the number of shots to keep is decreased, shots are released from the
front of the queue (without being deleted) until the queue is the
same size as the number of shots now being retained. This means
that if the user set to keep 100 shots, and then goes ahead and runs a
hundred shots, if they then set it to keep 5 shots it won't delete
the 95 oldest shots in the deletion queue. Rather it will only delete the
most recent 5 (and not immediately - over the next 5 shots). I think this is
close to what people will expect when changing the number, and it errs on the
side of keeping shots.

plugins called "shot_complete". The shot deletion is done in a
separate thread so as not to slow down the experiment in the case of blocking

to minimise the harm done if say, a lyse routine is reading the file.

There is sensible behaviour in the case of the user decreasing the number of

the 95 oldest shots in the deletion queue. Rather it will only delete the
most recent 5 (and not immediately - over the next 5 shots). I think this is
close to what people will expect when changing the number, and it errs on the
side of keeping shots.

plugins called "shot_complete". The shot deletion is done in a

values.message:
Functionality to delete repeated shots such that only a finite number of repeated
shots are kept on disk at any one time. This prevents consuming disk space in
the case of an expeiment being "kept warm" by being left in repeat mode.

This functionality is implemented via a plugin, using a new callback for BLACS
plugins called "shot_complete". The shot deletion is done in a
separate thread so as not to slow down the experiment in the case of blocking
calls, and a zlock lock is acquired on the file prior to deletion
to minimise the harm done if say, a lyse routine is reading the file.

There is sensible behaviour in the case of the user decreasing the number of
shots to retain on disk. Shots that are queued for deletion are kept in a queue,
and when the number of shots to keep is decreased, shots are released from the
front of the queue (without being deleted) until the queue is the
same size as the number of shots now being retained. This means
that if the user set to keep 100 shots, and then goes ahead and runs a
hundred shots, if they then set it to keep 5 shots it won't delete
the 95 oldest shots in the deletion queue. Rather it will only delete the
most recent 5 (and not immediately - over the next 5 shots). I think this is
close to what people will expect when changing the number, and it errs on the
side of keeping shots.

message.raw:
Add a 'run repeat' attribute to shot files. This is motivated in part by a plan
to change the MultiIndex lyse's DataFrame from the existing timestamp indexing
('sequence id', 'run time') to purely integer indexing, e.g. to:
('sequence index', 'run number', 'run repeat').
message.html:
Add a 'run repeat' attribute to shot files. This is motivated in part by a plan
to change the MultiIndex lyse's DataFrame from the existing timestamp indexing
('sequence id', 'run time') to purely integer indexing, e.g. to:
('sequence index', 'run number', 'run repeat').

values.message:
Add a 'run repeat' attribute to shot files. This is motivated in part by a plan
to change the MultiIndex lyse's DataFrame from the existing timestamp indexing
('sequence id', 'run time') to purely integer indexing, e.g. to:
('sequence index', 'run number', 'run repeat').

message.raw:
- Fix bug in anaysis submission when hostname didn't exist

- Catch all errors in analysis submission loop so that it continues even
if an unexpected exception occurs (pop up a zprocess error in thread for
visibility though)

- Don't pop up the "retrying" box if it's the first attempt to send files and
  there have been no problems yet.
message.html:
• Fix bug in anaysis submission when hostname didn't exist

  • Catch all errors in analysis submission loop so that it continues even
    if an unexpected exception occurs (pop up a zprocess error in thread for
    visibility though)

  • Don't pop up the "retrying" box if it's the first attempt to send files and
    there have been no problems yet.

summary.raw:
- Fix bug in anaysis submission when hostname didn't exist

- Catch all errors in analysis submission loop so that it continues even
if an unexpected exception occurs (pop up a zprocess error in thread for
visibility though)

- Don't pop up the "retrying" box if it's the first attempt to send files and
  there have been no problems yet.
summary.html:
• Fix bug in anaysis submission when hostname didn't exist

  • Catch all errors in analysis submission loop so that it continues even
    if an unexpected exception occurs (pop up a zprocess error in thread for
    visibility though)

  • Don't pop up the "retrying" box if it's the first attempt to send files and
    there have been no problems yet.

values.message:
- Fix bug in anaysis submission when hostname didn't exist

- Catch all errors in analysis submission loop so that it continues even
if an unexpected exception occurs (pop up a zprocess error in thread for
visibility though)

- Don't pop up the "retrying" box if it's the first attempt to send files and
  there have been no problems yet.

message.raw:
Split queue status label into two labels on
different lines, one for the status and one for the shot name,
to help with eliding text sensibly.

Disable word wrap on status label.
Shrink status messages to make them less likely to require elision.

Move delete button next to TreeView

Remove indentation from TreeView.

message.raw:
Elide tab text
Shorten device name/connection label to "name - [connection]"

Move shot delete button to left of queue.
Add "add shots" button - currently not connected since the menu action
for it isn't connected either.

Require labscript_utils 2.3 since we're using the QLabel elision widget it
introduced in 2.3

message.raw:
Interpret loading from saved data of blank stylesheet as implying the
default should be used. However, append '\n' to an actual blank stylesheet,
so that upon saving and loading, it can be recognised as an intentionally blank
one. This is for backward compatibility with the fact that an empty string
used to be what was stored when no changes to the default stylesheet had
been made.
message.html:
Interpret loading from saved data of blank stylesheet as implying the
default should be used. However, append '\n' to an actual blank stylesheet,
so that upon saving and loading, it can be recognised as an intentionally blank
one. This is for backward compatibility with the fact that an empty string
used to be what was stored when no changes to the default stylesheet had
been made.

so that upon saving and loading, it can be recognised as an intentionally blank
one. This is for backward compatibility with the fact that an empty string
used to be what was stored when no changes to the default stylesheet had
been made.

values.message:
Interpret loading from saved data of blank stylesheet as implying the
default should be used. However, append '\n' to an actual blank stylesheet,
so that upon saving and loading, it can be recognised as an intentionally blank
one. This is for backward compatibility with the fact that an empty string
used to be what was stored when no changes to the default stylesheet had
been made.

This way, if the default changes, people using the default will get
the change.

message.raw:
"Repeat last" functionality. The repeat button is still a check button,
but when clicked, it pops up a context menu asking which mode: repeat last
or repeat all (or no repeat).
It then is checked with its icon indicating which mode was selected,
or unchecked if "no repeat" was selected.

I've confirmed that this setting is saved and loaded correctly when BLACS
is restarted.

message.raw:
Removed additional frame around tab - now there is one fewer box around
the content. Removed content margins around the scroll area - all the contents
are themselves widgets with default margins anyway, so no need to double up
with excessive margins.

are themselves widgets with default margins anyway, so no need to double up
with excessive margins.
